title: Padma Lakshmi, Host of ‘Taste the Nation,’ On Great Food Towns and ‘Filthy’ TV Shows
sub_head: After months of lockdown, the ‘Top Chef’ veteran is back to feeding her wanderlust. Here, she tells us about her favorite U.S. city, what to buy at Muji and where to rollerskate in Paris.
body:
PADMA LAKSHMI first boarded a plane at age 4 to make a solo trans-Atlantic journey from New Delhi to New York to reunite with her mother. Travel continued to shape her life and career as an international model who hosted a variety show while living in Italy—long before she landed the gig as an itinerant co-host of Bravo’s “Top Chef.”
After the coronavirus pandemic grounded her for six months last year, Ms. Lakshmi’s wanderlust resurged stronger than ever. “Travel is as basic to my existence as being a woman is. I feel very passionately that the more we travel, the more we understand each other,” Ms. Lakshmi said in a phone interview from Houston, where she was filming “Top Chef” Season 19, which will air next year.
